data.title: Actors occupying a cell should have selection boxes no larger than that cell + health bar moved lower slightly
data.body:
There are two issues really;
1. Selection boxes of larger units are larger than an in-game cell, and as such 'overlap' horizontally with similar units to either side
2. Health bars are outside of a units selection box and float into the selection boxes of other units vertically above

Larger units currently have larger selection boxes which clip over other unit selection boxes. This means that such units that are horizontally adjacent have their health bars overlapping. For particularly 'large' units like the mammoth, you can have a unit take ~20% damage, but look like its at full health because of this overlap. Same for pips and passenger capacity.

Secondly, because the health bars of units are outside of the units selection box, when two units are vertically adjacent the health bar of the lower vehicle sites inside the selection box of the above vehicle. From a UI perspective this is slightly misleading.
![selection_boxes](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10311025/d702795e-6c3c-11e5-89aa-774a5144b95c.png)
As you can see, the med tank and heavys selection boxes overlap, and as such, so do their health bars. 

I propose two changes to solve this;
1. Any actor that occupies an entire cell should have a selection box the exact size of that cell
2. The health bar should be lowered slightly to sit within the selection box

like so; (ignore the poorly cropped med)

selected
![selection_boxes_proposed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10321641/b9f0b1a2-6c71-11e5-8a66-eabf4059745c.png)
unselected
![selection_boxes_proposed_unselect](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10321695/f7bc92a8-6c71-11e5-8ac3-a2f0372da2ec.png)

As you can see, when selected unit selection boxes (and health bars) no longer overlap. When unselected, there is at least a pixel of horizontal 'padding' between health bars.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27202148-actors-occupying-a-cell-should-have-selection-boxes-no-larger-than-that-cell-health-bar-moved-lower-slightly?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Replace chronotank blue charging pips to pink charging bar
data.body:
Currently the chronotank has a single 'chronoshift' / 'blink' ability. Although I would _love_ to see it have a double blink ability, I think using pips to display a 'support power' charging is inconsistent with the other support powers which display a pink bar as they charge. This could confuse newer players where pips represent passengers (or ore harvested in ore trucks)

The hue of the blue is also hard to see against temperate terrain.

![ctank](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10310227/d1308c18-6c38-11e5-8e1a-3bd9f8b45405.png)

data.title: Add passenger pips to 'always show status bars'
data.body:
'Always show status bars' currently shows unit health, support power charge / cool-down and capturing progress.

It would be nice to add passenger pips to 'always show status bars' since I would describe current passenger capacity as a status.

I think it's the only other 'overlay' (with exception of the selection box and spy's disguised eye overlay - and that appears at all times) that units can have. 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27200950-add-passenger-pips-to-always-show-status-bars?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Chinook selection box is too small
data.body:
In the current release the chinook selection box is too small causing the passenger pips to become stacked.

![chinook](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10309732/110490b2-6c36-11e5-9e0c-9cd7081399e8.png)

data.title: Units cannot be ordered to move under paradropping crates
data.body:
or infantry. I cannot comment about units moving under paradropping infantry in the last release but I'm _almost_ sure you could move a unit under paradropping crates. Now a unit will be directed to a cell adjacent to the crate until it has landed.

This means you can no longer waypoint a unit to collect a crate and go back to its original destination until the crate has landed.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27195849-units-cannot-be-ordered-to-move-under-paradropping-crates?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Health bars overlapping pips
data.body:
Can't see if this has been reported already but health bars and pips don't play well together on units with certain sized selection overlay boxes when 'pixel doubling' is not enabled. Resolution 1336 x 768

Both APCs are empty.

![pip](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/10304817/61954c1e-6c14-11e5-9e71-d7a629f4db4d.png)

From left to right:
-Top APC is selected, can't see the pips.
-Both APCs are selected, the top APC looks like it is full of passengers
-Bottom APC has been moved to reveal that the top APC has no passengers

This affects rangers, APCs, Chinooks and phase transports.

Possible 'easy' fix: vertical pips. Units with more pips than vertical/horizontal height can can have 'secondary' pips on the other side. This would allow for seeing health, support power charge / cool-down and passenger pips all at once. 

Although if #9559 is implemented, it would render this issue moot.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27195689-health-bars-overlapping-pips?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove "Hopes Anchor" from Official Maps
data.body:
a lot of new players choose this map and have no idea how to play this map ... theres no description anywhere about the actually "rules" on it ... and it looks like a normal map to them ... 

but the "tactical win" in 2 minutes makes this map a easy noob-trap 

we should remove this particular map from the Official Maps

data.title: AA guns don't detect/(shoot at) planes beyond map's edge
data.body:
Since planes can fly outside of the edge of the map AA guns should be able to shoot them down. Currently (release 20150919) it is not so.

![aacantreachbeyondedge](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10639257/10302247/bc1a47e8-6c0a-11e5-9624-5213f877289f.jpg)
This plane is clearly in the range of the AA gun but flies by undetected.

As seen in this replay at ~8:32 http://www.megafileupload.com/hQm1/AAcantReachBeyondEdge.orarep

data.title: "Emit infantry on destruction" trait / make SpawnActorOnDeath emit multiple units
data.body:
TD used to spawn actors when buildings were destroyed (e.g. Commando blows up a SAM site: two minigunners appear); there apparently exists an `EmitInfantryOnSell` trait, but there is no such thing as `EmitInfantryOnDestruction`.

`SpawnActorOnDeath` is not listed on https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits , but it seems it can only emit a single actor:

```
SpawnActorOnDeath:
  Actor: e1
```

```
EmitInfantryOnSell:
  ActorTypes: e6,e1,e1,e1
```

Also the traits are named inconsistently (`ActorTypes` & `Actor`, ProductionAirdrop uses `ActorType`), and wouldn't `SpawnActorOnSell` be better? (I guess it's possible to emit vehicles as well)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27181641-emit-infantry-on-destruction-trait-make-spawnactorondeath-emit-multiple-units?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add support for aggregate sequences
data.body: As requested in #9261.

data.title: Add panel-transparent to TD
data.body: This adds a new panel type to TD in preparation for the lobby changes, and saves a bit of performance by not tiling transparent sprites over the screen in the shellmap/ingame menu.

data.title: Fix a possible crash in WorldInteractionControllerWidget
data.body: Fixes #9468.

data.title: No music installed when launching replays directly
data.body:
In the current release, music is listed as not installed when launching oRA from a .orarep file. This did not happen last release. Fine when launching oRA as normal.

Ubunutu x64 14.04

data.title: Rename WithRotor to WithSpriteRotorOverlay
data.body: For more consistency, clarification and differentiation (there might be a `WithVoxelRotorOverlay` in the future).

data.title: Rename WithTurret, WithBarrel and WithReloadingTurret to include 'Sprite' in trait name
data.body:
To make 100% clear to any modder that these are render traits (not to be confused with `Turreted`, for example) as well as for more consistent naming.

Additionally pulled out `ZOffsetFromCenter` from former `WithTurret` into a new `RenderUtils`, since there's quite a number of traits using it by now.

data.title: Fix H and Home keys not working when the shroud debug option is enabled
data.body: Fixes #9530.

data.title: Prepare for lobby layout overhaul.
data.body:
This makes some simple changes to the lobby layout to make it much more maintainable.
- Split out the different top panels into their own files.
- Removed the special case handling of the player bin header.
- Automatically size the bin contents instead of hardcoding everything.

There should be no visible changes ingame, and I suggest using a diff tool to review - the real changes are only a handful of lines.

data.title: Make game last a few more seconds after it ended
data.body: Just 3 seconds more would allow more die/nuke/fun things after game ends.

data.title: Fix crash when launching the game directly into a mod with missing assets
Experience added to Player Actor, Statistics
data.body:
In order to eventually facilitate Support Powers as featured in Generals, I added the Trait PlayerExperience. This was inspired by the Pull Request #6221.

Experience is as of yet based on cost.

data.title: OpenRA.Utility: TD --map-import inaccurancies
data.body:
map import assumes all imported maps are multiplayer: waypoints 1-7 are imported as multiplayer-spawns, but they are used as "normal" waypoints in single-player missions:

``` bash
$ grep -i -r "waypoint" map.yaml
        waypoint27: waypoint
        waypoint26: waypoint
        waypoint25: waypoint
        waypoint12: waypoint
        waypoint11: waypoint
        waypoint10: waypoint
        waypoint9: waypoint
        waypoint8: waypoint

$ grep -i -r "spawn" map.yaml
        Actor281: mpspawn
        Actor282: mpspawn
        Actor283: mpspawn
        Actor284: mpspawn
        Actor285: mpspawn
        Actor286: mpspawn
        Actor287: mpspawn
        Actor288: mpspawn
```

Some waypoints have a special function in singleplayer and could be named as such:
- `waypoint25`: DefaultFlareLocation
- `waypoint26`: DefaultCameraPosition
- `waypoint27`: DefaultChinookTarget

Perhaps the utility could autodetect singleplayer maps or there could be a switch to take that into account?

Also, the utility help does not tell you which file it expects as input (.ini or .bin - requires trial&error to find out it expects the .ini file)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27150885-openra-utility-td-map-import-inaccurancies?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Refresh TD 1v1 map choices
data.body: This adds some maps suggested [on the forum](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=18726): [LostSouls](http://resource.openra.net/maps/5913/), [Island Duel](http://resource.openra.net/maps/4924/), [Sandstorm](http://resource.openra.net/maps/4609/), and [Aggressive Tendencies](http://resource.openra.net/maps/5858/).  I've also removed Deterring Democracy and Letters from Lexington as a start towards balancing out the map author distribution.

data.title: Copy palette.bin from disk and check it exists.
data.body: This should fix the issue mentioned in #9483.  It will need to be tested by someone with the disk before we can merge.

data.title: Cache WeaponInfo Look-ups
data.body: Uses the new `IRulesetLoaded` from #8760 to cache WeaponInfo look-ups.

data.title: [Editor] Creating New Map results in Access Denied error (simple chmod issue)
data.body:
Hey guys,

I'm using OpenRA on an up-to-date Ubuntu. When I try to create a new map with the default map folder settings, the openra binary crashes with an Access Denied error. After setting the chmod to 0777 for the `/usr/lib/openra/mods/ra/maps` folder, everything works properly.

I would either suggest to set the maps folder only to the /home/.openra/maps folder (or similar) or to fix the chmod within the debian packages' postinst script.

Obvious stacktrace is obvious, but I'm adding it here for convenience:

``` bash
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20150919
on map 04936ef1e2b49e43291c3c42d13bcaa2e089c00f (Desert Shellmap by Scott_NZ).
Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.19.0.25)
Runtime Version: Mono 3.2.8 (Debian 3.2.8+dfsg-4ubuntu4) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.UnauthorizedAccessException`: Access to the path "/usr/lib/openra/mods/ra/maps/battlefront.oramap" is denied.
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize, Boolean anonymous, FileOptions options) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.FileStream..ctor (System.String path, FileMode mode, FileAccess access, FileShare share, Int32 bufferSize) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at (wrapper remoting-invoke-with-check) System.IO.FileStream:.ctor (string,System.IO.FileMode,System.IO.FileAccess,System.IO.FileShare,int)
  at System.IO.File.Create (System.String path, Int32 bufferSize) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at System.IO.File.Create (System.String path) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib.Zip.ZipFile.Create (System.String fileName) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.ZipFile..ctor (System.String filename, Int32 priority, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 contents) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.CreatePackage (System.String filename, Int32 order, System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2 content) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Map.Save (System.String toPath) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.SaveMapLogic+<SaveMapLogic>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__2 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ButtonWidget.<ButtonWidget>m__A (MouseInput _) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.ButtonWidget.HandleMouseInput (MouseInput mi) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.HandleMouseInputOuter (MouseInput mi) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Widgets.Ui.HandleInput (MouseInput mi) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler+<OnMouseInput>c__AnonStorey2.<>m__0 () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[Boolean] (OpenRA.World world, System.Func`1 fn) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.DefaultInputHandler.OnMouseInput (MouseInput input) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.Sdl2Input.PumpInput (IInputHandler inputHandler) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.Sdl2GraphicsDevice.PumpInput (IInputHandler inputHandler) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.EndFrame (IInputHandler inputHandler) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.RenderTick () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.Run () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Run (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
```

data.title: "Go to base" hotkey doesn't work when cheats are enabled
data.body:
[This query](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/WorldCommandWidget.cs#L194) returns an empty list, because `world.RenderPlayer` is `null` for some reason. This is happening in a normal game, where I am an active player.
From there onward nothing happens.

P.S.: Seems to be a regression from #9307.
